Module WitchHunt
Package fr.sos.witchhunt.model.flow

Class Tabletop

java.lang.Object
fr.sos.witchhunt.model.flow.Tabletop
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public final class Tabletop extends Object implements Runnable

Class playing a central role, aggregating all of Model's components and controlling the game's flow.

Starts the match and starts new rounds until the victory conditions are met.

Contains a list of all players participating to the match.

Interacts with an instance of ScoreCounter to check whether victory conditions are met or not.

Instantiated as a Singleton using the static method. Can be accessed globally, exposing its public and non-static members, using the same method.

Implements Runnable. The whole match is supposed to stand within one thread, which can then frozen to simulate a delay between players' actions.

See Also:

  • playersList
  • Round

      private RumourCardsPile allCardsPile
      List containing all existing rumour cards in the match. They should never be cloned.

    • lastUnrevealedPlayer

      private Player lastUnrevealedPlayer

      Reference to the last player whose identity wasn't revealed at the end of a round.

      Is kept after a round in order to determine the first player to play the next one.

      See Also:
      • Round.checkLastUnrevealedPlayer()

    • gameIsTied

      private boolean gameIsTied
      This boolean becomes true when the game is tied, that is to say, when two players of more have the same score, the latter one being 5 or higher.

  • Constructor Details

    • Tabletop

      private Tabletop()

      Private Constructor called by the getInstance() method.

      Initializes the players list and creates a list containing one unique instance of each type of Rumour Card.

      See Also:
      • ExistingRumourCards

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Tabletop getInstance()
      Public and static method used for constructing an unique instance of it and accessing its non-static members
      Returns:
      A reference to the unique instance of this class.

    • addPlayers

      private void addPlayers()

      Creates and adds players permanently to the list of all participating players.

      First, the user specifies whether the player is going to be human-controlled or not.

      If they are, the user chooses a name.

      The minimum and maximum players numbers are attributes of this class.

    • resetStates

      private void resetStates()

      Reset the states of every player in the match.

      Calls the reset method of all players in the match.

      See Also:
      • Resettable
      • Resettable.reset()
      • Player.reset()

    • gameIsOver

      private boolean gameIsOver()

      Checks whether the victory conditions are met or not.

      Called after each round. While false is returned, a new one starts.

      Returns:
      Depends on the victory conditions defined at ScoreCounter.hasWinner().
      See Also:
      • ScoreCounter
      • ScoreCounter.hasWinner()
      • startMatch()

    • startMatch

      public void startMatch()

      Game-loop method. Handles game flow from the match's start to its end.

      First, sets up the match by requesting the users to add players.

      While the game has no unique winner, resets the states of every player and card and creates a new round.

      Creates a special round containing only leading players if the game is tied (gameIsTied

      Instanciates the match's score counter.
